title: Getting Started with Fibrae
content: Fibrae is an Effect-first JSX renderer where components are Effect programs with automatic reactivity. Unlike React, components can yield effects directly and event handlers can return Effects that are automatically executed.

title: Understanding Atoms
content: Atoms provide fine-grained reactive state management. Unlike React's useState, Atoms are defined at module scope and can be shared across components. Use Atom.family for parameterized atoms.

title: Building with Streams
content: Components can return Streams for progressive rendering. Combined with Suspense, this enables loading states and incremental updates. Perfect for real-time data or chunked responses.
